intro: Scurrula pentagonia, commonly known as the five-cornered scurrula, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
